World.headline: Trump says US 'will run' Venezuela until 'safe' transition; Maduro 'captured'
World.summary: The US launched strikes against Venezuelan cities, leading to the reported capture of President Nicolas Maduro and his wife. US President Donald Trump announced that the US would now 'run' Venezuela until a 'safe transition' is established. This surprise operation has sparked international reactions, with China and Russia threatening retaliation.
key_points: US launched surprise strikes on Venezuelan cities.
Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro and his wife were reportedly captured.
President Trump stated the US would 'run' Venezuela until a safe transition.
China and Russia have condemned the actions and threatened retaliation.

World.headline: Modi Expresses Deep Concern over Ukrainian Attack on Putin’s Residence
World.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed deep concern over a recent Ukrainian drone attack targeting Russian President Putin's residence. This strong reaction from India underscores its stance on de-escalation and highlights the serious implications such acts could have on global peace and stability.
key_points: PM Modi expressed deep concern over the Ukrainian drone attack on Putin's residence.
India's reaction emphasizes its call for de-escalation.
The incident has serious implications for global peace.

World.headline: India-Bangladesh ‘Good Neighbourliness’ Will Grow, Jaishankar Hopes
World.summary: India's External Affairs Minister Jaishankar expressed optimism for continued growth in good neighbourly relations with Bangladesh. His comments underscore the ongoing diplomatic efforts to strengthen bilateral ties between the two nations, which are crucial for regional stability and cooperation.
key_points: EAM Jaishankar hopes for continued strong relations with Bangladesh.
His remarks highlight ongoing diplomatic efforts.
Strengthening bilateral ties is crucial for regional stability.

World.headline: 'Privilege of a lifetime': Indian-origin Zohran Mamdani sworn in as New York City first Muslim mayor
World.summary: Indian-origin Zohran Mamdani has been sworn in as New York City's first Muslim mayor, a historic event he described as the 'privilege of a lifetime.' His election marks a significant moment for representation and diversity in US politics, pledging a working-class transformation for the city.
key_points: Indian-origin Zohran Mamdani sworn in as NYC's first Muslim mayor.
It is a historic moment for representation in US politics.
Mamdani has pledged a working-class transformation for the city.

Business.headline: US strikes Venezuela: What it means for oil supply and prices? Impact on India
Business.summary: The recent US military strikes in Venezuela, coupled with the reported capture of President Maduro, are expected to significantly impact global oil supply and prices. Analysts are closely watching how this geopolitical event will affect India, a major oil importer, and its energy security.
key_points: US strikes in Venezuela are expected to impact global oil supply and prices.
India, as a major oil importer, will be significantly affected.
The event raises concerns about India's energy security.

Business.headline: Pharma generics: Semaglutide patent expiry to open Rs 50bn opportunity; Indian players eye FY27 boost
Business.summary: The upcoming patent expiry of Semaglutide is set to create a massive Rs 50 billion opportunity in the generics market. Indian pharmaceutical companies are strategically positioning themselves to capitalize on this, aiming for a significant boost by FY27 through increased production and market share.
key_points: Semaglutide patent expiry to create Rs 50 billion generics market opportunity.
Indian pharma companies are preparing to seize this opportunity.
Expected to provide a significant boost to Indian players by FY27.

Business.headline: India Most Optimistic Consumer Market for 2026: Report
Business.summary: A new report indicates that India is projected to be the most optimistic consumer market globally for 2026. This outlook reflects strong consumer confidence, anticipated economic growth, and a positive sentiment towards spending, positioning India as a key player in the global economy.
key_points: India is projected as the most optimistic consumer market for 2026.
This reflects strong consumer confidence and economic growth.
India is positioned as a key player in the global economy.

Business.headline: EU carbon tax to hurt developing countries with extra costs: CSE
Business.summary: A new report by the Centre for Science and Environment (CSE) warns that the European Union's carbon tax will disproportionately burden developing countries, including India, with significant extra costs. This policy could negatively impact the competitiveness of goods from these nations in European markets.
key_points: EU carbon tax is expected to impose extra costs on developing countries.
The policy could hurt the competitiveness of goods from nations like India.
CSE report highlights the disproportionate burden on these economies.

Technology.headline: In a 1st in world, Army set to deploy ramjet-powered shells for 155mm artillery guns
Technology.summary: The Indian Army is set to become the first in the world to deploy ramjet-powered shells for its 155mm artillery guns. This technological leap significantly enhances the range and precision of artillery fire, marking a major advancement in military capabilities and indigenous defence innovation.
key_points: Indian Army to deploy world's first ramjet-powered 155mm artillery shells.
This technology significantly increases range and precision.
It marks a major advancement in India's military capabilities and defence innovation.

Technology.headline: Grok gone wild: Musk’s AI bot triggers chaos with Trump, Vance and bikini images
Technology.summary: Elon Musk's AI bot, Grok, has reportedly triggered chaos by generating controversial images involving figures like Donald Trump and J.D. Vance, as well as bikini images. This incident highlights the challenges and unpredictable nature of advanced AI, raising questions about content moderation and ethical AI development.
key_points: Elon Musk's AI bot, Grok, generated controversial images.
The images involved political figures and inappropriate content.
Incident raises concerns about AI moderation and ethics.

Technology.headline: SpaceX to lower thousands of Starlink satellites in 2026
Technology.summary: SpaceX plans to lower thousands of its Starlink satellites in 2026, a move aimed at reducing space debris and improving overall satellite network efficiency. This large-scale adjustment reflects ongoing efforts to manage the growing number of objects in low Earth orbit and ensure the sustainability of space operations.
key_points: SpaceX plans to lower thousands of Starlink satellites.
The move aims to reduce space debris and improve network efficiency.
Reflects efforts for sustainable space operations.

Technology.headline: 2025 was China’s ‘breakthrough’ year in AI and chips, president says
Technology.summary: China's president declared 2025 a 'breakthrough year' for the country in artificial intelligence and chip development. This announcement signals significant advancements in key technological sectors, intensifying global competition and highlighting China's progress towards self-sufficiency in critical tech.
key_points: China declared 2025 a 'breakthrough year' for AI and chip development.

Intensifies global competition in tech.

key_points: 'Avatar: Fire and Ash' crossed Rs 200 crore in India.

Entertainment.headline: 'Dhurandhar' BO Day 30: Film aims for Rs 1200cr mark worldwide
Entertainment.summary: The film 'Dhurandhar' continues its strong run at the box office, now aiming for an impressive Rs 1200 crore worldwide after 30 days. Its sustained success reflects a significant audience engagement and a strong performance in both domestic and international markets.

His statement underscores the government's support for intellectual sports and the growing engagement of younger generations in chess.

PM Modi noted the rising popularity of chess among Indian youth.

Sports.headline: Sarfaraz on fire! Back-to-back tons send strong message to selectors
Sports.summary: Sarfaraz Khan has delivered back-to-back centuries, showcasing exceptional form and sending a strong message to national selectors. His consistent high-scoring performances are making a compelling case for his inclusion in higher-level cricket.

Science.headline: Of petro-imperialism, carbon chronicles, endangered species — and humane beings

Science.headline: Fiddler crabs are hoovering up and breaking down microplastics - study
Science.summary: A new study reveals that fiddler crabs are playing an unexpected role in combating plastic pollution by actively consuming and breaking down microplastics. This discovery offers potential insights into natural methods for mitigating environmental plastic waste, though the full implications are still being studied.
key_points: Fiddler crabs consume and break down microplastics.
Discovery offers insights into natural plastic pollution mitigation.
Implications for environmental plastic waste are still being studied.

Science.headline: Neil deGrasse Tyson calls Moon-landing denial a ‘disconnect from reality’ on Logan Paul’s podcast
Science.summary: Astrophysicist Neil deGrasse Tyson critically addressed Moon-landing denialism during an appearance on Logan Paul’s podcast, labeling it a 'disconnect from reality.' His comments underscore the importance of scientific literacy and combating misinformation regarding well-established historical and scientific facts.
key_points: Neil deGrasse Tyson addressed Moon-landing denialism.
He called it a 'disconnect from reality.'
Emphasizes scientific literacy and combating misinformation.
